author: m.kalinin
content:
I see what you mean. That's a good point. But I think that `eth_` namespace is already a dependency for the consensus protocol up to a certain extent. Exposing it alongside the `engine_` at the same port won't make this dependency tighter.

Engine API spec already has the following statement:
> To facilitate an Engine API consumer to access state and logs (e.g. proof-of-stake deposits) through the same connection, the client **MUST** also expose the `eth` namespace.

https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/specification.md#underlying-protocol

author: m.kalinin
content: Do people think that EL should be able to have access to `SECONDS_PER_SLOT` and potentially other CL parameters. For instance, current Engine API spec suggests EL clients to expire payload building process after 12 seconds has passed since the slot in question. Does anybody have more use cases for CL params reads from the inside of EL?

content:
The kubernetes testnets that I've quickly mentioned in the call can be found in https://github.com/skylenet/ethereum-k8s-testnets  using helm charts from https://github.com/skylenet/ethereum-helm-charts/ .

The goal would be to also add an example for the merge. I think this can be useful when spawning up bigger testnets. I intend it be quite complete, including tooling, like block explorers (EL/CL), faucet, a website to download the genesis infos/configs(could reuse the launchpad website) so that you can join the network if you want.. etc. It also collects prometheus metrics from all clients/apps. One command to create it all.
